title: Everything coming to Netflix in June , including the final four episodes of Bridgerton season three
body_text:
Everything coming to Netflix in June, including the final four episodes of Bridgerton season three
From bingeable box-sets to silver-screen classics, the world's number one streaming platform has something for everyone this month
Netflix has a slew of new TV shows and films arriving on the platform in June for subscribers to add to their Watchlist.
Heading up the pack is the final four episodes of the third season of the streamer's hit regency drama Bridgerton, starring Irish actress Nicola Coughlan. The new season of the steamy drama sees the Galway actress take centre stage as it follows the friends-to-lovers romance of Penelope Featherington and Colin Bridgerton.
Also arriving on Netflix this month is Jordan Peele's sci-fi horror film Nope, along with the acclaimed action comedy Hit Man, starring Top Gun: Maverick actor Glen Powell.
READ MORE: Everything you need to know about Benedict Cumberbatch's new Netflix series Eric
Let's take a look at what Netflix has lined up for next month:
June 1
- Black Clover: Season 3 (Japanese) - Anime series about a duo of orphans raised at the same church, Asta and Yuno develop a friendly rivalry as they struggle to become the next Wizard King.
- Cold Copy - An ambitious journalism student falls under the thrall of an esteemed yet cut-throat news reporter whom she's desperate to impress, even if it means manipulating her latest story and the very idea of truth itself.
- Killing Eve: Season 3 (BBC) - Being recruited by an intelligence agency puts Eve in the direct path of Villanelle, an assassin. Though the mission is to kill her, the two women find themselves strangely drawn to each other.
- Lumberjack the Monster (Japanese) - After surviving an attack by a masked serial killer, ruthless lawyer Akira Ninomiya sets out on a path of revenge.
- New Amsterdam: Seasons - After becoming the medical director of one of the oldest public hospitals in the United States, Dr Max Goodwin sets out to reform the institution's neglected and outdated facilities to treat patients.
- One-Punch Man: Season 2 (Japanese) - Anime series about Saitama, a strong superhero who defeats villains with just a single punch. Over time, however, he grows bored with the absence of a challenging fight.
- Pilecki’s Report (Polish) - The heroic story of Captain Witold Pilecki, a WWII soldier who exposed the atrocities committed at Auschwitz, comes alive in this sweeping biopic.
- Strawberry Shortcake’s Summer Vacation - Strawberry Shortcake and her big-city besties spend summer vacation hunting for buried treasure to save her family's farm from a greedy businessperson.
- Swoon - When John and Ninni are drawn together, they must defy their families to save their rival amusement parks.
- The Pretty One - A shy and withdrawn woman assumes the identity of her glamorous twin sister after her death. As she experiences a radically new life, she must choose between keeping it up and revealing the truth.
- Too Old for Fairy Tales 2 (Polish) - After his mother's new boyfriend moves in, Waldek embarks on a daring journey through the Tatra mountains to find the father he's never met.
- Young Sheldon: Season 6 - Final season of the US comedy prequel to The Big Bang Theory about gifted but eccentric younger Sheldon Cooper.
June 2
- Taskmaster: Season 14 (Channel 4) - Five contestants compete in a series of bizarre challenges presented to them by Greg Davies, the taskmaster, and Alex Horne, his assistant, in order to win back their forfeited possessions.
June 3
- Little Baby Bum: Music Time: Season 2 - An animated, magical music show that encourages little ones to sing along, dance and make the connection between sound, mood and movement.
- Monster High - A teenage werewolf who is secretly half-human searches for a lost potion that can turn her into a full monster — and hopefully save her new high school.
- The Footballer, His Wife and the Crash - The death of former premier league star Jlloyd Samuel leaves his wife questioning whether she knew her husband when shocking revelations of a double life emerge.
June 4
- Antihero: Season 1 (Japanese) - Lawyer Hiroki Hasegawa defies Japan's 99.9% conviction rate and secures an acquittal despite overwhelming evidence. A look at how good and evil can shift, blurring ethical lines.
- Jo Koy: Live from Brooklyn - In this unfiltered stand up special, comedian Jo Koy takes on energy vampires, mumble rap, emoji flirting and the surprise of being called a zaddy.
- RIDE ON TIME: Seasons (Japanese) - Take a deep dive into the beautiful world of Japan's top male idol groups from number one producer Johnny's in this revealing docuseries.
- The Price of Nonna’s Inheritance (Italian) - When a grandmother falls for a cheeky suitor with dubious intentions, her family devises a secret plan to protect her life and their inheritance.
June 5
- Hitler and the Nazis: Evil on Trial: Season 1 - This gripping docuseries examines Adolf Hitler and the Nazis' rise, rule and reckoning from pre-WWII to the Holocaust to the Nuremberg trials.
- How to Rob a Bank - In this true-crime documentary, a charismatic rebel in 1990s Seattle pulls off an unprecedented string of bank robberies straight out of the movies.
- LEGO Ninjago: Dragons Rising: Season 1 (Weekly Episodes) - Two teenagers from different worlds use their Ninja powers to defend dragons from villains who want to harvest the dragons' life forces.
- The Contractor - A discharged U.S. Special Forces sergeant, James Harper, risks everything for his family when he joins a private contracting organization.
- The Hour: 2 Seasons - A journalist pursuing a criminal case mysteriously loses his memory and has to rely on his friends to gather pieces of his life and expose the guilty.
- Under Paris (French) - To save Paris from a bloodbath, a grieving scientist is forced to face her tragic past when a giant shark appears in the Seine.
June 6
- Baki Hanma VS Kengan Ashura (Japanese) - Baki Hanma is a young man who dedicates his life to fighting and wants to follow in the footsteps of his powerful father. Toki Taouma wants to become the strongest fighter. The two men come face-to-face.
- Basma (Arabic) - A young Saudi woman studying abroad returns to Jeddah, where she learns that her family has been shielding her from difficult truths.
- Kübra: Season 2 (Turkish) - When a suburban man receives messages that seem to predict the future, he develops a following
- Nelma Kodama: The Queen of Dirty Money (Brazilian) - Out of prison, notorious black-market currency trader Nelma Kodama exposes her part in a major Brazilian corruption scandal.
- Rafa Márquez: El Capitán (Mexican) - The Mexican defender recounts wins and losses in the world of football and beyond, revealing an intimate look into his dreams, detours and determination.
- Sweet Tooth: Final Season - On a perilous adventure in a post-apocalyptic world, a boy who's half-human and half deer searches for a new beginning with a gruff protector.
June 7
- Bodies Bodies Bodies - When a group of 20-somethings gets stuck at a remote mansion during a hurricane, a party game gone very, very wrong ends with a dead body on the ground and fake friends at every turn as they try to find the killer among them.
- Hierarchy: Limited Series (Korean) - The top 0.01 per cent of students control law and order at Jusin High School, but a secretive transfer student chips a crack in their indomitable world.
- Hit Man - A professor moonlighting as a hit man of sorts for his city police department, descends into dangerous, dubious territory when he finds himself attracted to a woman who enlists his services.
- Perfect Match: Season 2 (Weekly Episodes) - The mix-and-match dating show with single Netflix reality stars returns for a second season, hosted by Nick Lachey.
June 9
- Big Boys: Season 1 (Channel 4) - Two boys from very different ends of the "spectrum of masculinity" become best friends at Brent University freshers' week; in their first year at university, they explore, experiment and try to discover themselves, helping one another along the way.
June 11
- Tour de France: Unchained: Season 2 - Through tears and triumph, this engrossing docuseries follows several elite cycling teams as they compete in the world's most grueling bike race.
June 12
- King of Collectibles: The Goldin Touch: Season 2 - Ken Goldin and his savvy team run the thrilling action in this series that goes inside a leading auction house specializing in rare collectibles.
- Mysteries of the Terracotta Warriors - Thousands of terracotta warriors guarded the first Chinese emperor's tomb. This is their story, told through archeological evidence and reenactments.
- Remembering Gene Wilder - Interviews and never-before-seen footage provide insight into the life, career and legacy of actor and comedian Gene Wilder.
June 13
- Doctor Climax: Season 1 (Thai) - In 1970s Thailand, a dermatologist unexpectedly starts a mass sexual awakening after becoming Doctor Climax, a taboo-defying newspaper columnist.
- Bridgerton: Season 3, Part 2 - The final four episodes of the third season of the hit regency drama. Now that Colin has finally realized his true feelings for Penelope, the pair are seemingly on their way down the aisle, given how cozy they were inside Penelope’s carriage at the end of Part 1. However, because of Colin’s disdain for the gossip Lady Whistledown has spread throughout the Ton, Penelope’s “happily ever after” could be ruined if he ever finds out the truth about her secret identity
June 14
- Joko Anwar’s Nightmares and Daydreams: Season 1 (Indonesian) - A simple taxi driver discovers a mysterious nursing home. He's about to know the terrible secret that has been hid for a long time.
- Maharaj (Indian) - Follows Karsandas Mulji, a journalist and social reformer, who was a pioneering advocate for women's rights and social reform. A student at Elphinstone College in Mumbai and a protege of the scholar-leader Dadabhai Naoroji, Mulji wrote on widow remarriage, stood up for the oppressed, and sowed the seeds of reform in society. It all came to a head in the Maharaj Libel Case of 1862, which was ignited by allegations of misconduct by a prominent figure, the case garnered widespread attention and scrutiny, setting the stage for what many consider to be one of the most significant legal battles of all time.
- Nope - A man and his sister discover something sinister in the skies above their California horse ranch, while the owner of a nearby theme park tries to profit from the mysterious, otherworldly phenomenon.
- Ultraman: Rising - When Tokyo is threatened by giant monsters, an all-star athlete reluctantly returns home to take on the mantle of Ultraman, and become a legendary hero.
June 15
- My Hero Academia: World Heroes’ Mission (Japanese) - Japan's greatest heroes must work together to track down the mastermind behind a deadly chemical attack.
June 18
- Agents of Mystery: Season 1 (Korean) - An investigative team dedicated to special cases that cannot be solved by regular departments, tracking down cases at sites where strange things have happened.
- Outstanding: A Comedy Revolution - Explore the history of LGBTQ+ stand-up comedy in this funny and heartfelt documentary featuring personal stories from an all-star roster of performers.
- The Thin Blue Line: Seasons (BBC) - The Gasforth police station often is the scene of comic discord between the uniformed officers led by Inspector Raymond Fowler and the detectives under the supervision of Detective Inspector Derek Grim.
June 19
- Black Barbie - Discover the untold story of the first Black Barbie and the pivotal role three trailblazing women at Mattel had in creating a doll who looked like them.
- Inheritance (Polish) - The death of an eccentric inventor and gameshow host brings his family of greedy, bickering oddballs together as they seek to inherit his lucrative fortune. To everyone's shock, they must participate in a game of his creation, which will determine who inherits the fortune.1 May 2024
- Kleks Academy (Polish) - Teenage girl Ada ends up in mysterious Kleks Academy where crossing to the world of fairy tales and reaching boundaries of imagination is possible. She also discovers a way to find out her most hidden family secret.
- Love Is Blind: Brazil: Season 4 (Brazilian) (Weekly Episodes) - The dating experiment comes to Brazil as local singles look for true love and get engaged, all without meeting the other person face to face.
- Rick and Morty: Season 7 - Latest season of the hit animated show about Rick, an alcoholic sociopath and scientist, who lives with his daughter Beth's family. Apart from building gadgets, he takes his morally right but dimwit grandson Morty on absurd intergalactic adventures.
- Tad, The Lost Explorer and the Emerald Tablet - Tad discovers a rare sarcophagus, but accidentally unleashes an ancient spell endangering the lives of his friends. In his attempt to make amends, he sets off on an adventure that will take him to the far corners of the world.
- The End We Start From - When catastrophic floods submerge London, a new mother embarks on a dangerous journey to find a safe refuge, all the while trying to protect her baby from the surrounding chaos.
June 20
- America's Sweethearts: Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders: Season 1 - Follow the Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders from auditions to training camp and the NFL season as they chase their dreams and a coveted spot on the squad.
June 21
- Gangs of Galicia: Season 1 (Spanish) - A new lawyer arrives to settle in the small town of Cambados. Her name is Ana and her presence does not go unnoticed by anyone, including Daniel, the son of a major drug dealer.
- The Victim’s Game: Season 2 (Taiwanese) - Chinese-language series unfolds with a series of unexpected and suspenseful murder cases linked to an incident 15 years ago. The compelling series explores the complex yet highly relatable themes in human relationships, including the importance of belonging and the value of life.
- Trigger Warning - A special forces commando returns to her hometown after her father's sudden death, only to run afoul of a violent gang when she starts asking questions.
June 22
- Rising Impact: Season 1 (Japanese) - Anime series about Gawain Nanaumi, a third-grader with an incredible love for baseball and making the ball really fly. In a chance encounter with a female professional golfer, Kiria Nishino, he learns that golf will allow him to hit a ball further than any other sport.
June 25
- Kaulitz & Kaulitz: Season 1 (German) - Twin brothers and superstars Tom and Bill Kaulitz offer a glimpse into their private lives in LA and Germany in this funny and intimate reality series.
- The Ice Road - Action thriller starring Liam Neeson. After a remote diamond mine collapses in far northern Canada, a 'big-rig' ice road driver must lead an impossible rescue mission over a frozen lake to save the trapped miners.
June 26
- Worst Roommate Ever: Season 2 - Docuseries which features four stories about roommates with malevolent and sometimes violent intentions who turn the lives of their unsuspecting victims into real-life nightmares.
June 27
- Drawing Closer (Japanese) - With only a year left to live, 17-year-old Akito finds new meaning in life by bringing joy to a terminally ill girl who has just six months remaining.
- Supacell: Season 1 - When five ordinary South Londoners discover they have extraordinary powers, it's down to one man to bring them together to save the woman he loves.
- That 90s Show (Season 2 – Part 1) N – American sitcom and sequel to That 70s Show. In it, Leia Forman, Eric and Donna’s daughter, spends the summer with her grandparents, Red and Kitty.
June 28
- A Family Affair - A surprising romance kicks off comic consequences for a young woman, her mother and her movie star boss as they face the complications of love, sex and identity.
- Owning Manhattan: Season 1 - Real estate mogul Ryan Serhant leads one of the biggest firms in New York and pushes his agents to greatness while tackling the most expensive listings.
- The Mole: Season 2 - A group of contestants work together in a series of tasks to earn money as well as with the aim of identifying the one person who is tasked with sabotaging the team's plans.
- The Whirlwind: Season 1 (Korean) - Deputy PM Jung Soo Jin confronts him, sparking a fierce political struggle to change South Korea's politics.
